name: sign
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to write your name, usually on a written or printed document, to show that you agree with its contents or have written or created it yourself

example.eg: to sign a letter/cheque/contract/lease/agreement
example.egtrans: 在信件／支票／合同／租约／协议上签名

example.eg: Sign here, please.
example.egtrans: 请在这儿签名。

example.eg: He signed his name at the end of the letter.
example.egtrans: 他在信的末尾签上了自己的名字。

example.eg: He signed himself "Mark Taylor".
example.egtrans: 他签上了自己的名字“马克‧泰勒”。

example.eg: She said the painting was by Picasso, but it wasn't signed.
example.egtrans: 她说这幅画是毕加索创作的，但画上没有他的签名。

trans_examp.trans_en: in sport, to make a legal written agreement to employ a player

example.eg: The team has just signed a new player.
example.egtrans: 球队刚刚与一名新球员签约。

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give an order or information, or make a request, using hand and body movements

example.eg: He signed for/to the waiter to bring him another drink.
example.egtrans: 他示意侍者再给他一份饮料。

example.eg: He signed to the waiter that he wanted another drink.
example.egtrans: 他向侍者示意，想再要一份饮料。

trans_examp.trans_en: to use sign language (= language used by people who cannot hear or talk)

name: sign
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a notice giving information, directions, a warning, etc.

example.eg: a road sign
example.egtrans: 路标

example.eg: a shop sign
example.egtrans: 商店招牌

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a movement of the body that gives information or an instruction

example.eg: She pointed to her watch as a sign that it was getting late and she wanted to leave.
example.egtrans: 她指着手表示意已经很晚了，她想离开。

example.eg: He made/gave a sign to his boyfriend to stop talking.
example.egtrans: 她示意男朋友停止讲话。

example.eg: The priest made the sign of the cross (= made the shape of a cross by moving his hand between four points on his chest) when he entered the church.
example.egtrans: 牧师走进教堂时，在胸前画了个十字。

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something showing that something else exists or might happen or exist in the future

example.eg: His inability to handle the situation is a sure sign of weakness.
example.egtrans: 他无法控制局面无疑是一种软弱的表现。

example.eg: The fact that he's eating more is a sign that he's feeling better.
example.egtrans: 他能多吃东西表明他感觉好些了。

example.eg: I've searched for my hat, but there's no sign of it anywhere (= I can't find it).
example.egtrans: 我在找我的帽子，但到处都没有它的踪影。

example.eg: There was no sign of life in the building (= there seemed to be no one in it).
example.egtrans: 建筑物里看不到人影。

example.eg: Billy's work at school has shown signs of improvement this year.
example.egtrans: 比利的学业今年有进步的迹象。

example.eg: There is every sign that/All the signs are that the worst is over.
example.egtrans: 各种迹象表明，最糟糕的时期已经过去了。

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a written or printed mark that has a standard meaning

example.eg: + and - are mathematical signs.
example.egtrans: ＋和－是数学符号。

example.eg: £ is the sign for the British pound.
example.egtrans: £是表示英镑的符号。
